books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: The unforgettable novel of a childhood in a sleepy Southern town and the crisis of conscience that rocked it.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society, exploring the dangers of government overreach and media control.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A portrait of the Jazz Age in all of its decadence and excess.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: The story follows the main character, Elizabeth Bennet, as she deals with issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: Bilbo Baggins was a hobbit who wanted to be left alone in quiet comfort. But the wizard Gandalf came along with a band of homeless dwarves.

books.title: Lord of the Flies
books.author: William Golding
books.description: A group of British boys stuck on an uninhabited island who try to govern themselves with disastrous results.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenage boy who has been expelled from prep school and is wandering around New York City.

books.title: Animal Farm
books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A farm fable about the animals who rebel against their human farmer, hoping to create a society where animals can be equal, free, and happy.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A futuristic society that has embarked on a path to engineering social stability through genetic and conditioning technologies.

books.title: Fahrenheit 451
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a future where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.description: The epic tale of Odysseus and his ten-year journey home after the Trojan War.

books.title: Romeo and Juliet
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.description: The tragic story of two young star-crossed lovers whose deaths ultimately reconcile their feuding families.

books.title: Macbeth
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.description: A tragedy about a Scottish general who receives a prophecy from three witches that one day he will become King of Scotland.

books.title: The Scarlet Letter
books.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
books.description: Set in 17th-century Puritan Massachusetts, this novel tells the story of Hester Prynne, who conceives a daughter through an affair.

books.title: Algebra 1
books.author: McGraw-Hill Education
books.description: A comprehensive algebra textbook covering linear equations, inequalities, functions, and more.

books.title: Biology: The Dynamics of Life
books.author: Glencoe
books.description: A biology textbook covering cells, genetics, evolution, and ecosystems.

books.title: World History: Patterns of Interaction
books.author: McDougal Littell
books.description: A comprehensive world history textbook covering ancient civilizations to modern times.

books.title: Chemistry: Matter and Change
books.author: Glencoe
books.description: A chemistry textbook covering atomic structure, chemical reactions, and more.

books.title: Geometry
books.author: Holt McDougal
books.description: A geometry textbook covering points, lines, planes, and geometric figures.

books.title: The American Nation
books.author: Prentice Hall
books.description: A United States history textbook covering pre-colonization to modern America.
